body.p: A financial liability (or part of it) is extinguished when the debtor either:

li.p: discharges the liability (or part of it) by paying the creditor, normally with cash, other financial assets, goods or services; or
is legally released from primary responsibility for the liability (or part of it) either by process of law or by the creditor. (If the debtor has given a guarantee this condition may still be met.)
